page.title: 04HOUSING MATERIALS & PRICES
page.content: The Peak Park Planning Board will not allow large scale developments in the future. The most common new buildings are extensions to existing houses. Local sandstone is the most common material and natural slates are used to match. Fibre glass and double- glazing reduce heat loss. Central heating systems using gas, solid fuel or oil are usually fitted in new buildings. A new North Sea gas pipe- line is being constructed to supply the growing demand. House prices are usually 10% higher than in other local villages. A three- bedroom house would cost about Â£45,000. Bungalows being built in Baslow are priced at about Â£85,000.
